Organization or projects. Access, Adoption of OER, Community building, Content creation, Copyright and licensing, Deeper learning, Discoverability, Dissemination and awareness, Networks and sharing, OER research, Ongoing support, Policy, Reuse of OER, Sustainability, Teaching and learning, Tools and technologies, Training, Uses of OER
Map: Repository, Journal, Policy, and Other. Listing: Service or research study, Technical resource, Institutional resource

The mapping interface uses: OCW Repository, OER repository, OER practice, OER project, OER initiative, Ope Data for educational context, MOOC. Serendipity search permits filtering through: resource types (OER or OCW), topics, licences, tags, authors, languages, platforms, consortiums (OCW or Universia) as well as regiong categories (North America, Europe, Asia, Africa, South America), which are loaded from the OCW data that is being served
Not a finite scope, admin multiple
Name of the initiative and link

Allows for evidence-based information, including: partners, Key challenges addressed, Issues addressed, Potential Solutions specified, Research claims made, Evidence specified, Managing organizations, Resources, Themes

university, universityName, universityLat, universityLong, universityLogo, universityDescription, universityContinent, universityCountry, universityCity, universityURL, universityOCWURL, universityOCWURSS, universitySubject, universityAddress, consortium, consortiumURL, language, languageURL, license, licenseURL, ocw, ocwURL
Site with limited data on a service platform
A map model, with static information on OCW as a demosntration

The platform is more positioned as an evidence base for OER projects and their claims, but the mapping system itself is complimentary, rather than the center-piece of the project. Allows for heavy data input on each project and a list view
It has a clean interface and is simple to use, but the taxonomy does not make it easy to identify initiatives. Allows for list view
Multiple ways to visualize the results: as a map, as a search with detailed (table) linked data on each initiative, as a downloadable list (JSON), and multiple aggregate data visualization methods
